name: BBCWorld
text:
More than 200 schools in South Korea have been forced to close just days after they re-opened, due to a new spike in coronavirus cases

But before they closed we spent the day with pupils to see what changes were being made

https://t.co/O9FfnFXwnJ https://t.co/CEzYa03RG9

name: BBCWorld
text:
Khadiza, a refugee from Myanmar, was made homeless and stateless in 2017 after her husband and son were killed in army operations and her village was torched 

She sought shelter in Bangladesh, in what is now the world’s largest refugee camp, Cox’s Bazar
https://t.co/XMIKuWP2d9 https://t.co/hnWuEUX28D

name: BBCWorld
text:
In hope of a better life for her family, Khadiza sold her jewels, putting together $750 (£610) to pay traffickers to take them to Malaysia

"I had been planning for months. I wanted a better life. I was dreaming of a new life in a new country," she says
https://t.co/XMIKuWP2d9 https://t.co/kPdAdnCwJp

name: BBCWorld
text:
They set out in February, first on a small boat, and were transferred to a larger vessel after two days 

This bigger boat was so crowded Khadiza couldn’t even stretch her legs
https://t.co/XMIKuWP2d9 https://t.co/bQumm5oMmP

name: BBCWorld
text:
They arrived in Malaysia after sailing for seven days

But no boats were there to meet them

The government tightened security during the pandemic, with more coastguard patrols making it harder to sneak into the country

They were forced to retreat
https://t.co/p9NHbIhiCB https://t.co/USMRwgcdG4

name: BBCWorld
text:
Now stuck at sea, the hundreds on board faced a shortage of food and water

In desperation, some refugees drank seawater
https://t.co/XMIKuWP2d9 https://t.co/C98plo9Doq

name: BBCWorld
text:
The death of a woman sat next to her traumatised Khadiza

Severely dehydrated, the woman was disoriented and behaving strangely:

"I am still haunted by her death. She died in front of our eyes"
https://t.co/XMIKuWP2d9 https://t.co/ChLWIVCrjg

name: BBCWorld
text:
Khadiza estimates “50 or even more” people died on board

Her son, an Imam, officiated their funerals
https://t.co/XMIKuWP2d9 https://t.co/4fJdyJt3rs

name: BBCWorld
text:
The boat was intercepted by the the Burmese navy, and some of the crew arrested 

But they were soon released 

"People were getting desperate. We kept asking ourselves how long we could survive like this"
https://t.co/XMIKuWP2d9 https://t.co/S9Z8qtaKnA

name: BBCWorld
text:
They managed to steer themselves back to Bangladesh 

"I was so happy when I finally saw the coast for the first time in two months." Khadiza remembers

"I lost everything for my dream… Never make the mistake I made"

https://t.co/XMIKuWP2d9
